5 fun things this week

Events this weekend and beyond

5 fun things this week

Louisville 7:26 a.m. EST November 26, 2014

Important schedule.(Photo: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

CONNECT 6 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Light Up Louisville & 40 Nights of Lights. Downtown, Friday. The event kicks off at 2 p.m. with the Run, Run Rudolph 5K run/walk. The annual Light Up Parade begins at 6:30 p.m. and runs along Fourth Street from Liberty to Main streets. The highlight is Santa Claus' arrival at 8 p.m. to join Mayor Greg Fischer on the Main Stage (Fourth and Main streets) to insert the "magic" plug to turn on thousands of lights on buildings and trees. The show is capped off with fireworks. www.lightuplouisville.org.

F.A.T. Friday Trolley Hop. 10 a.m.-10 p.m. Friday. Connects businesses in Clifton, Crescent Hill and Butchertown. Free trolleys run from Johnson Street in Butchertown to Frankfort and Stilz avenues with a stop at the Mellwood Arts & Entertainment Center. Transportation provided by TARC. www.fatfridayhop.org.

16th Annual Holiday Taste and Business Expo: Shop. Eat. Drink. Jeffersontown Community Center, 10617 Taylorsville Road, 4-7 p.m. Tuesday. More than 70 businesses, restaurants and caterers will participate with holiday ideas, gifts, gourmet food and spirits samplings, discounts, giveaways and a charity raffle. Dave Dafoe, Moonshine University founder, will present "From Blueberries to Bourbon How Beverages are Created" (5 p.m.). Proceeds from the raffle will benefit Camp Quality Kentuckiana. Sponsored by Kroger and Lite 106.9. $10, $5 children. lou-e.org.

Rock For Kosair. Phoenix Hill Tavern, 644 Baxter Ave., 7:30 p.m. Saturday. This year's show features 15 bands, three stages and four guitar giveaways. Performers include Infantry #333, The Smokin Gorillas, 16 Bones, Deadlight Redemption, Signal the Revolution, Zebras In Public, Unleashed, Krosjoint, Grindstone, Rock Brigade, Bury the Wicked, Year of the Gun, Mooseknuckle, Digg, Jayson William Allen, John Hager and others. Proceeds from the show will buy toys for Kosair Kids. $10 at the door.

Derby Dinner Playhouse. 525 Marriott Drive, Clarksville, Thursday. Enjoy the show ("A Wonderful Life") and a Thanksgiving buffet. Buffet, 11:45 a.m.-1 p.m.; show 1:30 p.m. $41. (5812) 288-8281.

TAKE THE KIDS: Top fun things for families

BARS & CLUBS: 5 spots for live music

ON STAGE: Productions now playing

And lots more stuff to do ...

Events

Light Up Louisville & 40 Nights of Lights. Downtown, Friday. The event kicks off at 2 p.m. with the Run, Run Rudolph 5K run/walk. The annual Light Up Parade begins at 6:30 p.m. and runs along Fourth Street from Liberty to Main streets. The highlight is Santa Claus' arrival at 8 p.m. to join Mayor Greg Fischer on the Main Stage (Fourth and Main streets) to insert the "magic" plug to turn on thousands of lights on buildings and trees. The show is capped off with fireworks. www.lightuplouisville.org.

40 Nights of Lights. 6-11 p.m. Friday and Saturday; 6-10 p.m. Sunday-Thursday. The nightly light show will be presented on the half hour synchronized to holiday music. Four blocks of Fourth Street (from Main Street to Muhammad Ali Boulevard) will come aglow with thousands of strands of multicolored LED lights that will animate 250 snowflake and fleur de lis fixtures. Runs nightly through Jan. 4.

Light Up Louisville is accepting donations of unwrapped new toys for Toys for Tots. A collection box will be at Santa's Workshop in the Fourth Street lobby of the Kentucky International Convention Center.

F.A.T. Friday Trolley Hop. 10 a.m.-10 p.m. Friday. Connects businesses in Clifton, Crescent Hill and Butchertown. Free trolleys run from Johnson Street in Butchertown to Frankfort and Stilz avenues with a stop at the Mellwood Arts & Entertainment Center. Transportation provided by TARC. www.fatfridayhop.org.

4th Street Live Ice Rink. Part of Light Up Louisville and 40 Nights of Lights. Hours: 11 a.m.-11 p.m. Friday; 10 a.m.-11 p.m. Saturday; 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Sunday; 11 a.m.-7 p.m. Monday-Thursday. Through Dec. 26. Admission: $5 an hour, $3 for ages 12 and younger per hour, $10 day pass, $40 season pass, $2 skate rental.

4th Street Live Holiday Village. Part of 40 Nights of Lights. Saturdays, 11 a.m.-8 p.m. through Dec. 20. More than 15 artisans, boutiques and more.

Rock For Kosair. Phoenix Hill Tavern, 644 Baxter Ave., 7:30 p.m. Saturday. This year's show features 15 bands, three stages and four guitar giveaways. Performers include Infantry #333, The Smokin Gorillas, 16 Bones, Deadlight Redemption, Signal the Revolution, Zebras In Public, Unleashed, Krosjoint, Grindstone, Rock Brigade, Bury the Wicked, Year of the Gun, Mooseknuckle, Digg, Jayson William Allen, John Hager and others. Proceeds from the show will buy toys for Kosair Kids. $10 at the door.

16th Annual Holiday Taste and Business Expo: Shop. Eat. Drink. Jeffersontown Community Center, 10617 Taylorsville Road, 4-7 p.m. Tuesday. More than 70 businesses, restaurants and caterers will participate with holiday ideas, gifts, gourmet food and spirits samplings, discounts, giveaways and a charity raffle. Dave Dafoe, Moonshine University founder, will present "From Blueberries to Bourbon How Beverages are Created" (5 p.m.). Proceeds from the raffle will benefit Camp Quality Kentuckiana. Sponsored by Kroger and Lite 106.9. $10, $5 children. lou-e.org.

Spectator sports

University of Louisville vs. University of Kentucky. Papa John's Cardinal Stadium, 2800 S. Floyd St., noon Saturday. Football. $78. (800) 745-3000.

University of Louisville Cardinals vs. Lafayette College Leopards. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 7 p.m. Friday. Women's basketball. $10. (800) 745-3000.

University of Louisville Cardinals vs. Ohio State Buckeyes. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 9:30 p.m. Tuesday. Men's basketball. $41. (800) 745-3000.

Churchill Downs. 700 Central Ave., 11:30 a.m. Thursday; 12:40 p.m. Friday-Sunday. $3. (502) 636-4400.

Thanksgiving dining

Austin's. 4950 U.S. 42. Thanksgiving buffet with turkey, ham, mashed potatoes, dressing, sweet potato casserole, corn, green beans, corn, salad, rolls and desserts. $19.95, $8.95 for ages 4-10, free for ages 3 and younger; carryout meal for $16.95. Reservations, (502) 423-1990.

Blu Italian Grille. Marriott Downtown, 280 W. Jefferson St., will offer a buffet with seatings at noon, 1, 2, 3 and 4 p.m. Thursday. The meal includes appetizers, egg and waffle station, pasta station; carving station, turkey and prime rib; entrees, pomegranate and wild flower honey glazed salmon, Kentucky country ham, roast garlic mashed potatoes, green bean casserole, creamed corn and desserts. $39 for adults, $19 for ages 4-11 and complimentary for ages 3 and younger. Reservations are requested. (502) 671-4285.

Crowne Plaza Louisville Thanksgiving. 830 Phillips Lane, 11 a.m.-2:30 p.m. Thursday. Variety of breakfast and lunch options, Thanksgiving favorites, carving stations and a wide array of desserts. $35, $29 seniors, $16 for ages 6-12, free for ages 5 and younger. Reservations, (502) 367-2251 ext 4187.

Derby Dinner Playhouse. 525 Marriott Drive, Clarksville, Thursday. Enjoy the show ("A Wonderful Life") and a Thanksgiving buffet. Buffet, 11:45 a.m.-1 p.m.; show 1:30 p.m. $41. (5812) 288-8281.

Galt House Thanksgiving Dinner. Archibald Room, 140 N. Fourth Street, 11 a.m.-4 p.m. Thursday. A traditional Thanksgiving buffet with all the trimmings. Reservations, (502) 568-4241.

Golden Corral. Open Thanksgiving Day; 4032 Taylorsville Road, (502) 485-0004; 5362 Dixie Highway, (502) 447-6660; 8013 Preston Highway, (502) 966-4970.

J. Graham's Cafe, The Brown Hotel, 335 W. Broadway, will offer seatings from 11:15 to 11:45 a.m. and 1:15-1:30 p.m. Thursday. The buffet includes soups, variety of fall salads, imported meat and pickled vegetable bar, fresh seafood, carving stations with roasted turkey and Kentucky ham and an assortment of domestic and imported cheeses. Additional options include seared Atlantic salmon, buttermilk mashed potatoes, sweet potatoes with candied pecans, charred vegetable medley, fig and apple stuffing and desserts. $37 plus tax and gratuity, $17 for ages 4-12 and complimentary for ages 3 and younger. Reservation required, (502) 583-1234, ext. 7225.

J. Harrods, 7507 Upper River Road. Buffet 11:30 a.m.-4 p.m. Thursday. $21.95, $10.95 for ages 12 and younger. Reservations, (502) 228-4555.

KT's. 2300 Lexington Road. Thanksgiving buffet with turkey, ham, mashed potatoes, dressing, green beans, corn, cranberry relish, rolls and dessert. $19.95, $9.95 for ages 4-10, free for ages 3 and younger. (502) 458-8888.

Rivue Restaurant & Lounge Thanksgiving Dinner. Galt House Hotel, 140 N. Fourth Street, 11 a.m.-5 p.m. Thursday. A traditional Thanksgiving dinner. Reservations, (502) 568-4239.

Spirit of Jefferson Thanksgiving Cruise. River Road, board at 12:30 p.m.; cruise 1-3 p.m. Thursday. Traditional Thanksgiving meal. $48, $32 for ages 3-12. (502) 574-2992.

Film

Planetarium shows. Gheens Science Hall & Rauch Planetarium, 108 W. Brandeis Ave. $8, $6 for ages 12 and younger, seniors and University of Louisville students. (502) 852-6664.

Saturday: "Perfect Little Planet," 1 p.m.; "Laser Magic," 2 p.m.; "Black Holes: The Other Side of Infinity," 3 p.m.

Cruise

Spirit of Jefferson Pre-Light Up Louisville Cruise. River Road, Friday. Board at 4 p.m.; cruise from 4:30-5:30 p.m. $15. (502) 574-2992.

Spirit of Jefferson Light Up Louisville Moonlight Cruise. River Road, Friday. Board at 9 p.m.; cruise from 9:30-11 p.m. $17. (502) 574-2992.

Spirit of Jefferson Dinner/Sightseeing Cruise. Fourth and River Road, Saturday. Board at 6:30 p.m.; cruise from 7-9 p.m. $43, $42 seniors, $27 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Dances

Nuts N Honeys Dance Club. Dance Louisville, 8023 Catherine Lane, 7-11 p.m. Friday. Beginner and intermediate line dancing and couples dancing. $5. (502) 643-2786 or bigalofamerica@aol.com.

Singles Dance. Moose Lodge, 4615 Fegenbush Lane, 7:30-11 p.m. Sunday. Music by Kenny Sauter's Masters of Music DJ Service. Door prizes. $6 before 8 p.m.; $7 after 8. (502) 736-7600.

Exhibits

21c Museum Hotel. 700 W. Main St. "Transporting Transformation: Cuba, In and Out," by Jose Toirac, Sandra Ramos and others; "Chito Yoshida: Love for Sale," by Chito Yoshida; "A Thirsty Switch Still Quivers For Me," by Gina Phillips. "Burnouts," by Julia Christensen. All end April 2015. (502) 217-6300.

Actors Theatre of Louisville Gallery. 316 W. Main St. "Kentucky Watercolor Society: Aqueous USA 2014," 37th annual juried exhibition. Ends Dec. 23.

The Arts Council of Southern Indiana. 825 E. Market St. "The Party in My Head," by Kent Epler. Ends Jan. 10.

Asia Institute Crane House. 1244 S. Third St. "Poking the Lillies Pad," ceramic works by nationally recognized, emerging Asian American artists. Ends March 15, 2015.

B. Deemer Gallery. 2650 Frankfort Ave. "Simply Louisville," by Steven Walker. Ends Dec. 17.

Bridge Gallery. Mellwood Art Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. "Seasons," by Carol Labashosky. Ends Dec. 15.

Carnegie Center for Art & History. 201 E. Spring St., New Albany. "Earth-Tones: Art Quilts," by Penny Sisto. Ends Jan. 10.

Conrad-Caldwell House Museum. 1402 St. James Court. "Louisville's River." Ends May 31, 2015.

Filson Historical Society. 1310 S. Third St. "Steamboating on Western Waters." Ends Dec. 30. (502) 635-5083.

Frazier History Museum. 829 W. Main St. "Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous: Art, Fashion & Luxury During the Gilded Age." Ends Feb. 1. "Irving Berlin's White Christmas: The Exhibit." Ends Jan. 11. Opening Friday, "Holidays Around the World," display of trees, lights and traditional holiday objects. Ends Jan. 4.

Gadabout Gallery and Artisan Shoppe. 249 Spring St., Jeffersonville. "Gifted: 50 Artworks Under $50." Ends Sunday.

Galerie Hertz. 1253 S. Preston St. "Architectoplyast: Debrided Surfaces," by Jim Doiron. Ends Jan. 3.

Gallery Janjobe. Mellwood Arts Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. "Presents! Presents!," one-of-a-kind gifts by gallery artists and guest artists. Reception Friday, 6-9- p.m., during all-day FAT Friday Trolley Hop. Ends Dec. 24.

The Gallery at Mann and Fox. Professional Towers, 401 Dupont Circle, Suite 505. "The Art of Embroidery," by Bette Levy. Ends Dec. 31.

Garner Narrative Contemporary Fine Art. 642 E. Market St. "Deconstructing Melancholy," by Aleksandra Stone. Ends Friday.

The Green Building. 732 E. Market St. "Incommunicado," a three-dimensional exhibit by Amy Chase, Patrick Donley and Brad White. Ends Friday.

Heart Gallery. 902 E. Washington St. "Core Constellation," by Amy Stephens McClain. Ends Friday.

Horseshoe Gallery. Horseshoe Casino, 11999 Casino Center Drive, Elizabeth, Ind. "Delectable." Ends Dec. 31.

Huff Gallery. Spalding University, 853 Library Lane. "Ligne Rouge." Ends Dec. 19.

Jane Morgan Gallery. 4838 Brownsboro Center. "Paths in Nature." Ends March 14, 2015.

Jeffersontown Historical Museum. 10635 Watterson Trail. Historic photos and artifacts. Ends Dec. 19.

Kaviar Forge & Gallery. 1718 Frankfort Ave. "Abstract in Kentucky." Ends Jan. 3.

Kentucky Derby Museum. 704 Central Ave. "Horse Play," highlighting the playful side of the Kentucky Derby and featuring historical equine toys, digital interactives and music created for the museum. Ends Dec. 31. (502) 637-1111.

Kentucky Fine Art Gallery. 2400-C Lime Kiln Lane. Works by Jaime Corum, Lynn Dunbar, Robert Halliday and David Schuster.

Kentucky Science Center. 727 W. Main St. "The World We Create." Permanent exhibit that explores science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through collaborative and open-ended challenges.

Kentucky Watercolor Society Gallery. 4836 Brownsboro Road. "Celebrating the Season in Watercolor." Ends Jan. 31.

Local Speed. 822 E. Market St. "Remix: Stephen Paul Day, Sibylle Peretti, The Leight Collection." "Color Me Justice," works created by students from Maryhurst Academy. Both end Feb. 21.

Louisville Free Public Library. 301 York St. "Black Freedom, White Allies and Red Scare: Louisville, 1954." Ends Saturday.

Metro Hall. 527 W. Jefferson St. "Infinite Perspectives," by Ann Stewart Anderson, Ashley Brossart and Dhamin Jassim. Ends Jan. 16.

Paul Paletti Gallery. 713 E. Market St. "Small Worlds," photographs by Margaret Oechsli. Ends Dec. 29.

Peyton Samuel Head Family Museum. Oldham County History Center, 106 N. Second St., La Grange. "I Pledge Allegiance: Honoring Our World War II Veterans." Ends March 22, 2015.

Portland Museum. 2308 Portland Ave. Works by Julius Friedman. Ends Dec. 23.

Pyro Gallery. 909 E. Market St. "Esthesia," by Carrie Burr, Paula Keppie and Wendi Smith. Ends Dec. 27.

Revelry Boutique Gallery. 742 E. Market St. "Louisville Noir," photographic portrait series by Tom LeGoff. Ends Dec. 4.

Swanson Contemporary. 638 E. Market St. "En el Espirtu de Frida," honoring the 60th anniversary of the death of the great Mexican painter Frida Khalo. Works by Pilar Acevedo, Diane Khalo, Joe McGee, Mari Mujica and Jacque Parsley. Ends Jan. 3.

Tim Faulkner Gallery. 1512 Portland Ave. "Lines" a new collection of oil paintings by Jen Goodell. Ends Dec. 14.

University of Louisville's Cressman Center for Visual Arts. 100 E. Main St. "The Sardonic Eye: Bob Lockhart in Context." Ends Dec. 24.

Wayside Expressions Gallery. Wayside Christian Mission, 120 W. Broadway. "Colors," by Creative Diversity Studios. Ends Tuesday.

Zephyr Gallery. 610 E. Market St. "Project 5: Stranger Than Function." Ends Dec. 20.

Other attractions

Lazer Blaze. 4121 Shelbyville Road, Friday, 4 p.m.-midnight; Saturday, 10 a.m.-midnight; Sunday, noon-9 p.m.; Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, 4-9 p.m. Laser tag, laser tag museum, arcade, cafe. $7 per game, $12 for two games. (502) 895-2985.

Robben's Roost. 5906 Six Mile Lane, Friday, 7-11 p.m.; Saturday, 1-4 and 7:30-10:30 p.m.; Sunday, 1-4 p.m.; Tuesday and Thursday, 11 a.m.-1 p.m. Roller skating. Fridays, $6; Saturday afternoons, $4, evenings, $5; Sundays, $4; Tuesdays and Thursdays, $3. (502) 491-8170.

Skate World. 6310 Preston Highway, 7-11 p.m. Fridays; 1-4 and 7-11 p.m. Saturdays; 1-4 p.m. Sundays, Tuesdays and Thursdays. Roller skating. Friday and Saturday evenings, $5; Saturday and Sunday afternoons, $4; Tuesdays and Thursdays, $3. (502) 969-6000.

Wheel Fun Rentals. Waterfront Park. 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. Bike rentals: cruisers, tandems, choppers, quad sports, deuce coupes, four-wheel surrey bikes. Group rates available. www.wheelfunrentals.com.

Open Range Sports. 6401 Cross Keys Blvd., Crestwood, 4-8 p.m. Friday; 11 a.m.-8 p.m. Saturday; noon-5 p.m. Sunday. Indoor paintball/reball and a gun range. (502) 243-8282; www.openrangesports.com.
